p: It was indeed our intention to speculate that FSA had a particular behaviour of peaking in 2015, when overall case counts in Brazil peaked in 2016, but we did not intend to focus on FSA being an anomaly – we understand, however, how our statements could be misleading. We also agree that relating our results of low observation rates and potential (estimated) changes of the surveillance system between 2015 and 2016 should be better contextualized for observations across the country. We have therefore followed the Editor’s advice and have now changed our statements in the main text, as highlighted below.
